required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Including Sprints During Low-intensity Cycling Exercises on Performance and Muscle/Blood Characteristics
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Including 30-s Sprints During Low-intensity Cycling Exercises During a Training Camp on Performance and Muscle/Blood Characterisitcs

lead_sponsor.agency: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences

clinical_study.source: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effects of Including 30-s sprints during low-intensity cycling exercises during a training camp on performance and muscle/blood characterisitcs in elite cyclists

detailed_description.textblock:
Inclusion of sprint intervals during low-intensity training (LIT) sessions has been suggested as a potential mean to improve endurance performance in elite cyclists, facilitated by muscular or systemic physiological adaptations. So far, the effects of such training has been studied exclusively in context of short-lasting low-intensity sessions, representing a scenario with suboptimal ecological validity for such highly trained athetes.
This study will investigate the effects of including sprints during prolonged LIT-sessions sessions during a 14-day training camp focusing on LIT, followed by 10 days recovery (REC), on performance and performance-related measures in elite cyclists. During the training camp, a sprint training group will conduct 12x30-s maximal sprints during five LIT sessions, whereas a control group will perform distance-matched LIT-only. Overall, the training camp will lead to substantial increases in training load compared to habitual training in both intervention groups, followed by subsequent reductions during REC. Performance tests will be conducted before the training camp (T0) and after REC (T2). Muscle biopsies, hematological measures and stress/recovery questionnaires will be collected Pre (T0) and after the camp (T1).
The study was pre-registered at Norwegian Center for Research Data (14/08/2017, Norwegian): http://pvo.nsd.no/prosjekt/55322

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Investigating the effects of including sprints during low-intensity training sessions during a 14-d training camp with increased training load on performance and muscle/blood biology

primary_outcome.measure: Performance during a 5-minute all-out cycling test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, after REC)
primary_outcome.description: Mean power output measured during a 5-minute all-out cycling test performed at the end of a ~2 hour long exercise protocol

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean power output measured during four consecutive 30-s maximal sprints

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal oxygen consumption measured during an incremental cycling exercise test to exhaustion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal aerobic power output measured as mean power output during the last minute of an incremental cycling exercise test to exhaustion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Contribution of total energy turnover to power output in the fresh and fatigued state incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Contribution of total energy turnover to power output in the fresh and fatigued state incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Power output at lactate threshold (training camp)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Power output at 4 mmol blood lactate concentration measured during an incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Power output at 4 mmol blood lactate concentration measured during an incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Fractional utilization of VO2max measured at 4 mmol blood lactate concentrations measured during an incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Fractional utilization of VO2max measured during the 5-min test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Protein abundances in m. vastus lateralis measured using western blotting

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin mass measured using CO rebreathing (g)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin mass measured using CO rebreathing (g)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Red blood cell volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Red blood cell volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean corposcular volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean corposcular volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Hematocrit measured using centrifugation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Hematocrit measured using centrifugation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass (kg) measured using Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass (kg) measured using Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Enzyme activity in m. vastus lateralis measured using ELISA kits (I.e., CS and PFK)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Lean body mass (kg) measured using Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Lean body mass (kg) measured using Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass (kg) measured using Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass (kg) measured using Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the training camp (14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Session rate of percieved exertion (sRPE) measured after each exercise involving sprints/control exercise using a 9-point scale ranging from "very, very demotivated" to "very, very motivated" (1 to 9)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the training camp (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Recovery state of participants measured using Recovery-Stress Questionnaire for Athletes (RESTQ-36-R-Sport, 36 questions, 7-point scale ranging from 0/never to 6/always)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T2, i.e. after REC)
secondary_outcome.description: Recovery state of participants measured using Recovery-Stress Questionnaire for Athletes (RESTQ-36-R-Sport, 36 questions, 7-point scale ranging from 0/never to 6/always)

other_outcome.time_frame: From four weeks prior to the intervention and throughout the study, an average of 52 days
other_outcome.description: Training load calculated as time spent in different heart rate zones using the individualized TRIMP method

intervention.intervention_name: Inclusion of sprints during low-intensity cycling during a 14-day training camp (high training load)
intervention.description: Inclusion of 12x30-s maximal sprints during five low-intensity cycling sessions with long duration (>fours hours per session). Five sessions will be performed as low-intensity cycling-only (Controll sessions, distance matched). All other sessions will be performed as low-intensity sessions and adjusted according to each participants training load goal to reach an increase of ~50% in load compared to habitual training.

intervention.intervention_name: Low-intensity cycling during a 14-day training camp (high training load)
intervention.description: Five low-intensity cycling sessions (>four hours per session), distance-matched to sprint group.
Habitual low-intensity cycling (>0.5-2 hours per session)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- VO2max > 65ml/kg/min
Exclusion Criteria:
- VO2max < 65ml/kg/min
- Average endurance training per week >10hrs/wk during the four weeks leading up to the study

facility.name: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences
